page.syntax: Result_String as C = a5_extract_advance(C string ,C Start_string ,C End_string [,L include_tags [,L case_sensitive ]])

argument.name: Result_String
argument.description: The data found between Start_String and End_String.

argument.name: Start_string
argument.description: The text that bounds Result_String on the left. Character

argument.name: End_string
argument.description: The text that bounds Result_String on the right. Character

argument.name: include_tags
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. ; .F. = Does not return the Start_String and End_String, .T. = Returns the Start_String and End_String. Logical

argument.name: case_sensitive
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F., .F. = The search for Start_String and End_String is not case sensitive, .T. = The search for Start_String and End_String is case sensitive.

page.description: Extracts the first occurrences of a sub-string starting with 'start_string' and ending with 'end_string'.
page.discussion: The A5_EXTRACT_ADVANCE() function will find and return the text between two character strings, optionally including the two character strings.
page.example: ? a5_extract_advance("this is a string with several words", "string", "several", .f., .f.) = " with "
